Violation_Type: Failure to meet refugee eligibility criteria
Legal_Issue: Whether the Board's rejection of the applicant's refugee claim based on lack of nexus to a Convention ground and failure to rebut the presumption of state protection was reasonable
Application_Facts: Applicant is a Mexican police officer who arrested a drug lord and subsequently received threats; did not report threats due to mistrust in authorities
Remedy_Requested: Judicial review of the Immigration and Refugee Board’s decision
Defendant_Behavior: Failed to report threats to local authorities
Grounds_for_Claim: Fear of persecution by a non-state actor (drug lord) after performing official duties
Legal_Standard: Reasonableness standard for state protection findings; correctness for interpretation of social groups under s. 96
Assessment_Factor: Credibility of claimant's fear, existence of state protection, membership in a protected social group
Applicable_Legislation: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act, section 96
Procedural_Issue: Judicial review following administrative decision by the Immigration and Refugee Board
Credibility_Assessment: Board found applicant's failure to seek state protection undermined credibility regarding state inability to protect
Evidence_Used: Threats from drug lord, applicant's status as police officer, lack of reporting to authorities
Legal_Provision_Cited: Section 96 of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Application_Basis: Claim of persecution based on political opinion or particular social group
Evidence_Assessed: Nature of threats, applicant’s actions post-threat, institutional capacity of Mexican state
Governing_Rule: The state protection presumption applies unless rebutted; nexus to a Convention refugee ground required
Evidentiary_Deficiency: Failure to provide evidence of attempts to access state protection in Mexico
Outcome: Application for refugee status denied; judicial review dismissed
Harm_Assessment: Risk of harm from non-state actor without sufficient state protection
Cause_Description: Applicant fled Mexico fearing retaliation from a drug lord after arresting him
Evidence_Handling: Board assessed lack of engagement with state authorities as undermining claim
Legal_Provision_Violated: Failure to meet definition of Convention refugee under s. 96
Evidence_Issues: Lack of corroboration or explanation for not reporting threats
Residency_Compliance: Applicant entered Canada and applied for refugee status
Legal_Provision: Section 96, Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Jurisdictional_Issue: Federal Court jurisdiction over judicial review of IRB decisions
Evidence_Assessment: Board reasonably concluded applicant did not rebut presumption of state protection
Decision_Rationale: No sufficient evidence of lack of state protection; insufficient nexus to a protected social group
Evidentiary_Issues: Failure to report threats limits evidentiary support for claim of state inability to protect
